citation.article-title: Bacillus arsenicoselenatis, sp. nov., and Bacillus selenitireducens, sp. nov.: two haloalkaliphiles from Mono Lake, California that respire oxyanions of selenium and arsenic.

p.s: Description of Bacillus arsenicoselenatis sp. nov.
Bacillus arsenicoselenatis (ar.se.ni.co.se.le.na'tis. G.n. arsenikon, yellow orpiment; M.L.gen.n. selenatis, of selenate; M.L.gen.n. arsenicoselenatis, of arsenic (and) selenate)
Cells 3.0–10 μm long and 0.5–1.0 μm wide.
Strict anaerobe that demonstrates respiratory growth with Se(VI), As(V), Fe(III), nitrate, and fumarate as electron acceptors.
Uses lactate, malate, fructose, starch, and citrate as electron donors.
Moderate halophile and alkaliphile isolated from Mono Lake, California.
